snippet: Elders of the Blackfeet in Montana have decided to use their land’s resources to transform a reservation scarred by poverty, but many in the group see the land as sacred.
abstract: Elders of the Blackfeet tribe in Montana have decided to tap into shale oil reserves on tribal land, allowing hydraulic fracturing operations in hopes of transforming a reservation scarred by poverty; move has divided the tribe, as many of its members see the land as sacred and drilling an irrevocable transgression.
lead_paragraph: Elders of the Blackfeet in Montana have decided to use their land’s resources to transform a reservation scarred by poverty, but many in the group see the land as sacred.

headline.seo: Montana Tribe Divided on Tapping Oil-Rich Land
headline.main: Tapping Into the Land, and Dividing Its People
